snippet: A long-awaited study has confirmed the fears of Somali residents in Minneapolis that their children suffer from higher rates of a disabling form of autism compared with other children there.
abstract: Collaborative study from the University of Minnesota, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Autism Speaks confirms that children of Somali parents in Minneapolis suffer higher rates of disabling autism than other children there; study, led by Dr Amy S Hewitt, offers no reason for higher incidence among these immigrants.
lead_paragraph: A long-awaited study has confirmed the fears of Somali residents in Minneapolis that their children suffer from higher rates of a disabling form of autism compared with other children there.

headline.main: Study Links Autism and Somalis in Minneapolis
headline.print_headline: Study Links Autism and Somalis in Minneapolis
